Articles.Content:
Something has changed. I'm not sure what. I was checking CKAN for mod updates, and I got a message that a huge list of mods had meta data updates and it asked me if I wanted to re-install them, so I did. Since then, ever ship I've built (and some that were there before and fine) has this uncontrollable spin, and the really odd part is it seems to come and go! What I mean by that last statement is, it seems to be related to targetting or maneuver nodes...I can get the ship to stop spinning, _some of the time_ if I set up a new maneuver node, or if I click it into warp for a second, then back out...the ship will usually start to spin again, but if it is slow enough, and I keep my eyes on how fast I let it get, I can stop it, or slow it enough to make the next maneuver. However, it isn't just in one direction...it may spin clockwise, it may spin counterclockwise.   At first I thought it was competing probe cores, but all of my probe cores are set to hibernate, except the one that is currently operating the craft. It seems to happen more often on ascent/circularization, then goes away for one stage, but then comes back when I stage next. 

 

I'm thinking about doing a complete uninstall and reinstall of the game, then the expansion packs, and finally the dozens of mods I have installed and seeing if that fixes it. I've had other oddities over the years, that a complete, fresh install seemed to fix it.

It sounds like you may have a problem with "phantom forces".

My most frequent trigger for that is EVA construction; it gets so bad that ships can accelerate and torque so much parts explode into each other.  Part offsetting in VAB can also cause phantom forces. The Kerbal Joint Reinforcement KJR mod can have problems if I am not using the correct version for my KSP, but I don't see KJR in your mod list.

In your case, I'll add that since you updated so many mods, maybe some of your commonly used parts that were ok before had their size or colliders modified. Your previously good ship designs might now be getting phantom forces.

Here's what I would try:

  1. I hope you made a backup before upgrading mods so you can revert if needed. This would be a backup of your entire KSP folder including setting files and mods, not merely a KSP savefile.
  2. Make a new backup of your current setup.
  3. Uninstall the PersistentRotation mod. Do ships still rotate uncontrollably? If not, re-add PersistentRotation and see if the problem starts again. If PersistentRotation is triggering your phantom forces, consider playing without it or ask for help in that mod's thread.
  4. Continue checking other mods as needed. Focus on mods that affect all of your rotating ships. Tweakscale? Dock Rotate if all affected ships have docking ports? KSP Recall in case some of its patches changed?
